title: Looking for Biganne (hand printed script)
content:
Hi!  
I have looked for the font “Biganne” on the web, but could not find the site I can buy it from. Do you guys know where I can find it?  
Thank you!

 [‹ (x) "Capri" stone carved sign - ITC Tiffany {Henning}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070805143103/http:/typophile.com/node/19553 "Go to previous forum topic") [Godard title sequence typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070805143103/http:/typophile.com/node/19549 "Go to next forum topic")
author: misalion

comments.content:
I think it might look like this, although I am not sure...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070805143103im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cabin.jpg)

How did you learn that the name of this was ’Biganne’? I ask this because I used Fontseek and Google on that name and ’Big Anne’ with no result.

I also made the assumption that maybe that’s NOT the name, and looked among similar fonts in the Script Font ID Guide — no matches.

It’s possible that this is a ’personal font’, since this type of font can be easily made by anyone who can print. In that case, your only chance is to contact the place where you saw this and ask them about how to get the font.

If that fails, then look for something similar, because there are too many hand-printed fonts to search them all.

- Mike Yanega
I recieved the logo from the customer, and when I opened it in Illustrator it said that it was missing the font “Biganne.” I also did seach and could not find the font.
